item.title: Intersection test and optimal allocation of 2D axis-aligned boxes using linear programming
item.description: (function () { var script = document.createElement(“script”); script.type = “text/javascript”; script.src = “http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML”; document.getElementsByTagName(“head”)[0].appendChild(script); })(); Either-or trick In this solution, we will make use of the either-or trick. The constraints in a program are all in and, but we want some of them to be in or. Consider the following logic formula: \(a\ge b\vee c\ge d\). It can be written with the following and constraints: \[ \begin{alignedat}{2}\, & M\cdot x\; & +a\; & \ge b\\ \, & M\cdot\left(1-x\right)\; & +c\; & \ge d\\ \, & \, & x\; & \in\left\{ 0,1\right\} \end{alignedat} \] where \(M \gt 0\) is big (depending on the specific context as we’ll see later).
